activity.name: Manage product development
activity.description: the act of using tools and personnel to establish product requirements based on company requirements and standards, practices and procedures

activity.name: Develop product design
activity.description: the activity in which a representation of the form, fit and function of a product is created, analyzed, tested and released

activity.name: manage design
activity.description: the activity in which a representation of the form, fit and function of a product is created, analyzed, tested and released

icom.name: Administrative data
icom.description: data associated with the design of the product that originates from design management
icom.example: Examples of this type of data are company name, supplier code, security classification and contract number.

icom.name: Analysis and test data
icom.description: data created during the design process and used to evaluate the design

icom.name: Analysis and test models
icom.description: representations of the product design data used to evaluate the design

icom.name: Analyze and test design
icom.description: the process of assessing the product's design against its requirements

icom.name: Assembly layout
icom.description: a representation of how individual parts fit together to make assemblies

icom.name: Assembly requirements
icom.description: constraints on the product design that pertain to the way the parts fit together to make an assembly

icom.name: Change request disposition
icom.description: a document describing the formal engineering response to a request for change to the engineering design

icom.name: Conceptual design layout
icom.description: a representation of how design ideas are visualized to become a product

icom.name: Conceptualize product design
icom.description: the process of taking design ideas, requirements and design constraints, and turning them into a formalized description of the design
icom.note: This is comprised of conceptual design layout and assembly requirements.

icom.name: Configuration controlled product design data
icom.description: product design data logged into the formal configuration control system

icom.name: Configuration control feedback
icom.description: deviations from standards, practices and procedures that relate to the engineering design approval process

icom.name: Contractual requirements
icom.description: items specified in a legal document relating directly to product design

icom.name: Control product design data
icom.description: formal product identifiers, such as part number and part version, that ensures conformance with established requirements, standards, practices and procedures

icom.name: Company requirements
icom.description: those managerial decisions that place constraints on the operations of the company, that give direction or emphasis on areas for development, or that dictate decisions outside the local decision making paths These include the embodiment of policies and regulations that govern the operations of a company.

icom.name: Define and formulate product design
icom.description: the process of synthesizing a product design
icom.note: This process, which includes conceptual, preliminary and detailed design, is accomplished by theoretical analysis, design simulations and alternate design evaluations.

icom.name: Design change request
icom.description: a formal request to change any form, fit or function aspect of an existing design

icom.name: Design concept
icom.description: a formal expression of the design ideas for the product

icom.name: Design constraints
icom.description: restrictions that influence the creation of the design

icom.name: Design feedback (design alternatives)
icom.description: analysis of previous or alternate designs used to formulate a new design

icom.name: Design ideas
icom.description: the conceptualization of form, fit and function requirements for a suggested product design

icom.name: Design integration structure
icom.description: the representation of how multiple assemblies and subassemblies can be brought together to form functional systems

icom.name: Distribution request
icom.description: the formal document asking for copies of the product design to be forwarded to the appropriate personnel in an organization

icom.name: Distribution tracking information
icom.description: the data that identifies organizations or individuals who received some quantity of the released engineering product design data

icom.name: Drawing corrections
icom.description: drawing changes based on standard drafting practices within a particular organization

icom.name: Engineering change authorization
icom.description: an engineering document that identifies the design being released or changed
icom.note: It specifies what is to be done to the design and authorizes the design change activity.

icom.name: Existing product information
icom.description: official design information about a product

icom.name: Inspection, process, material requirements
icom.description: inspection requirements, processes done and material characteristics required to satisfy the product's designed form, fit and function

icom.name: Licensed technology
icom.description: patented or proprietary processes or design information purchased or licensed from an outside source, such as a supplier or fabricator

icom.name: Life-cycle requirements
icom.description: information required by the design that effect supportability, manufacturability and maintainability

icom.name: Management directives, schedule, budget
icom.description: the result of the management planning activities that effect the product design

icom.name: Product configuration identifiers
icom.description: identifiers for the approved design which indicate its usage within the product structure

icom.name: Product design data
icom.description: information produced by the design process that defines the form, fit and function of a product

icom.name: Establish product requirements
icom.description: the activity that captures the product requirements

icom.name: Product requirements
icom.description: criteria that specifies the functionality and characteristics of the product that includes mission, costs, functions, market appeal

icom.name: Product data
icom.description: information about the product

icom.name: Product structure
icom.description: the relationship of the items to each other within the definition of a product

icom.name: Project directives
icom.description: documents that describes project policy such as revisions to standard techniques, customer directions and special case requirements

icom.name: Released engineering product design data
icom.description: the engineering approved product design data that has been released under the control of an appropriate engineering authority

icom.name: Release status
icom.description: provides the information as to when, what and to whom data has been disseminated

icom.name: Research papers
icom.description: any documentation which describes processes or innovations uncovered due to the development of the product design
icom.example: trade studies, lessons learned, patent descriptions.

icom.name: Specifications, standards, practices and procedures
icom.description: formalized documentation that influences the design activity to ensure commonality between products

icom.name: Standard part information
icom.description: product design data from standards organizations

icom.name: Personnel and tools
icom.description: the personnel and tools from the contractor, customer or supplier

icom.name: Sythesize and refine configuration
icom.description: the process of ensuring the form, fit and function from one sectionof the design into the overall product

icom.name: Tool requirements
icom.description: the tooling required to support the testing, manufacturing and fabrication of a product design

icom.name: Establishing product requirements
icom.description: the process of establishing the criteria for the product that includes mission, objectives, costs, functions and market appeal

icom.name: Project requirements
icom.description: the criteria derived from the establishing product requirements activity that provide mission statements, budgets, and other data related to managing the project

icom.name: Manage project
icom.description: the process of planning, scheduling and controlling other project activities to meet the project objectives
